title: COVID-19 Critical Care Nursing Education Program

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental nursing theory and clinical practice experience
context.additional_context: Blended learning-based education conducted in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments. Strengthened language domain application cases for pre-service/in-service teachers

learning_goals: Learners can explain the procedures for using respiratory support equipment in COVID-19 critical care with 90% accuracy.
Learners can effectively write symptom assessments and nursing intervention plans for critically ill patients in case-based scenarios with over 80% accuracy.
Learners develop strategies to enhance practical skills by utilizing peer assessment and feedback systems in blended learning environments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
